bibl.title: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to Henry Rose Carter, June 27, 1924

div1.p: Fricks invites Carter to attend a conference of malaria field workers in New Orleans, Louisiana.

div1.head: Letter from Lunsford D. Fricks to Henry Rose Carter, June 27, 1924
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MALARIA INVESTIGATIONS
FIELD HEADQUARTERS
ROOM 17, COURTHOUSE
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
MEMPHIS, TENN.
June 27, 1924.
Malaria,
or n. m. Cain
meeting.
Asst. Surgeon General H. R. Carter,
U. S. Public Health Service,
2121 California Street, NW.,
Washington, D.C.
Dear Dr. Carter:
div1.p:
We expect to hold a conference of malaria
field workers in New Orleans at the time of the Sou-
thern Medical Association Meeting, November 24-27,
1924. We would like to have you attend this confer-
ence and take part in our round table discussions of
current malaria problems.

Mr. LePrince and I would like to have sug-
gestions from you of topics which you consider worth
while discussing at a conference of this character,
and which you would like to have brought up at our
next meeting.
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, L. D. Fricks, Surgeon,
Medical Officer in Charge. Answered July 1/24
